page.title: 07Mr.Buckle's Farm.
page.content: On 6th June 1985 two children from St Barnabas School visited Mr Buckle's farm in Oak Lane, Easterton.It was raining so they didn't see much but they did find out something about the farm. Mr Buckle is an{Arable}farmer which means he only grows crops. He keeps animals for pets and poultry to supply the farmhouse. The farm is 70 acres altogether, mostly fields.He has some land that he can't farm either because its woodland or rough ground which he can't use because he hasn't got any animals to graze on it. Mr Buckle grows wheat for milling,straw for thatching,other straw for potatoes and protein peas for animal feed.He spends 80 hours a week working on the farm.
